item.name: ğŸ” AUTHENTICATION ENDPOINTS
item.description: Public authentication endpoints - no authentication required

request.description:
**Purpose**: Self-registration for new users

**Access**: Public (no authentication required)

**Expected Response**: 201 Created

**Role Assignment**: All users start as 'user' role

**Body Parameters**:
- `email` (string, required): Valid email address
- `password` (string, required): Strong password
- `first_name` (string, required): User's first name
- `last_name` (string, required): User's last name
- `organization_id` (string, optional): Organization to join (if applicable)

**Notes**: 
- Creates user with default role 'user'
- Password must meet security requirements
- Email must be unique
- Role promotions done by admins later

**Purpose**: Authenticate user and get JWT tokens

**Access**: Public (no authentication required)

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Body Parameters**:
- `email` (string, required): User's email
- `password` (string, required): User's password

**Response**:
- `access_token`: JWT token for API access
- `refresh_token`: Token for refreshing access token
- `token_type`: Always 'bearer'
- `user`: User information including role

**Notes**: 
- Save the access_token for subsequent requests
- Access token expires in 30 minutes
- Use refresh token to get new access token
- Check user role for available features

**Purpose**: Register and automatically join an organization using invite token

**Access**: Public (no authentication required)

**Expected Response**: 201 Created

**Body Parameters**:
- `email` (string, required): Valid email address
- `password` (string, required): Strong password
- `first_name` (string, required): User's first name
- `last_name` (string, required): User's last name
- `join_token` (string, required): Organization invitation token

**Notes**: 
- Creates user and adds to organization in one step
- Join token must be valid and not expired
- Email may need to be on organization whitelist
- User becomes 'member' of the organization

**Purpose**: Get new access token using refresh token

**Access**: Public (no authentication required)

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Body Parameters**:
- `refresh_token` (string, required): Valid refresh token from login

**Response**:
- `access_token`: New JWT token for API access
- `token_type`: Always 'bearer'

**Notes**: 
- Use when access token expires
- Refresh token has longer expiry than access token
- Updates the access_token variable automatically

**Purpose**: Logout user and invalidate tokens

**Access**: Requires authentication (Bearer token)

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {access_token}

**Notes**: 
- Invalidates current session
- Client should clear stored tokens
- No body parameters required

item.name: ğŸ›ï¸ ORGANIZATIONS ENDPOINTS (UPDATED)
item.description: Organization management with proper tenant admin scoping - Multi-role access

request.description:
**Purpose**: Create a new organization within a tenant

**Access**: Multi-role with proper scoping
- **Super Admin**: Can create organizations for any tenant
- **Tenant Admin**: Can create organizations within their tenant only
- **Org Admin**: Cannot create organizations

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**UPDATED BEHAVIOR**: Proper tenant admin scoping implemented

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Body Parameters**:
- `name` (string, required): Organization name
- `description` (string, optional): Organization description
- `tenant_id` (UUID, conditional): Parent tenant ID
  - Super Admin: Can specify any tenant_id or omit for standalone org
  - Tenant Admin: Automatically uses their tenant_id (ignores provided value)
- `max_users` (int, optional): Maximum users allowed (default: 500)

**Real-World Usage**:
- Super Admin creates tenant, then assigns tenant admin
- Tenant Admin creates departments within their company
- Each organization gets unique join token

**Notes**: 
- Generates unique join token for invitations
- Returns created organization with join token
- Tenant admins are restricted to their tenant scope

**Purpose**: Get list of organizations with role-based filtering

**Access**: Multi-role with automatic scoping
- **Super Admin**: All organizations across all tenants
- **Tenant Admin**: Only organizations within their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Organizations they manage
- **User**: Organizations they belong to

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**UPDATED BEHAVIOR**: Proper tenant admin scoping implemented

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {token}

**Query Parameters**: 
- Results automatically filtered by user role and permissions
- No manual tenant filtering needed for tenant admins

**Real-World Usage**:
- Tenant Admin sees all departments in their company
- Org Admin sees only their specific departments
- Regular users see only their assigned organization

**Notes**: 
- Results filtered by user permissions automatically
- Returns organization summaries
- Includes user's role in each organization
- Tenant admins get full visibility within their tenant

**Purpose**: Get detailed information about a specific organization

**Access**: Users with access to the organization
- **Super Admin**: Any organization
- **Tenant Admin**: Organizations in their tenant
- **Org Admin/Members**: Organizations they belong to

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `org_id` (UUID, required): Organization ID

**Notes**: 
- Returns detailed organization information
- Includes join token for admins
- 403 if user doesn't have access
- 404 if organization not found
- Tenant admins can access any org in their tenant

**Purpose**: Update organization information

**Access**: Organization administrators with proper scoping
- **Super Admin**: Any organization
- **Tenant Admin**: Organizations in their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Only their assigned organization

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `org_id` (UUID, required): Organization ID to update

**Body Parameters**:
- `name` (string, optional): New organization name
- `description` (string, optional): New description
- `max_users` (int, optional): New maximum user limit

**Notes**: 
- Partial updates supported
- Returns updated organization information
- Tenant admins can update any org in their tenant

**Purpose**: Delete an organization and all associated data

**Access**: High-level administrators only
- **Super Admin**: Any organization
- **Tenant Admin**: Organizations in their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Cannot delete organizations

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `org_id` (UUID, required): Organization ID to delete

**Notes**: 
- âš ï¸ **DESTRUCTIVE OPERATION** - Deletes all organization data
- Removes all users from organization
- Deletes all associated predictions
- Only super/tenant admins can delete organizations
- Tenant admins limited to their tenant scope

**Purpose**: Generate a new join token for organization invitations

**Access**: Organization administrators
- **Super Admin**: Any organization
- **Tenant Admin**: Organizations in their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Their assigned organization

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `org_id` (UUID, required): Organization ID

**Response**:
- `join_token`: New invitation token
- `expires_at`: Token expiration time

**Notes**: 
- Invalidates previous join token
- Use for sending organization invitations
- Token has limited validity period
- Tenant admins can regenerate for any org in their tenant

**Purpose**: Get list of users in the organization

**Access**: Organization members and administrators
- **Super Admin**: Any organization
- **Tenant Admin**: Organizations in their tenant
- **Org Admin/Members**: Their organization

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `org_id` (UUID, required): Organization ID

**Response**: Array of user objects with roles

**Notes**: 
- Shows all users in the organization
- Includes user roles and status
- Filtered based on viewer permissions
- Tenant admins can view users across all orgs in their tenant

**Purpose**: Add an email to organization whitelist for join access

**Access**: Organization administrators
- **Super Admin**: Any organization
- **Tenant Admin**: Organizations in their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Their assigned organization

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `org_id` (UUID, required): Organization ID

**Body Parameters**:
- `email` (string, required): Email address to whitelist

**Notes**: 
- Allows email to join organization via token
- Email validation performed
- Prevents duplicate entries
- Tenant admins can manage whitelists for all orgs in their tenant

**Purpose**: Get list of whitelisted emails for the organization

**Access**: Organization administrators
- **Super Admin**: Any organization
- **Tenant Admin**: Organizations in their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Their assigned organization

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `org_id` (UUID, required): Organization ID

**Response**: Array of whitelisted email addresses

**Notes**: 
- Shows all emails allowed to join organization
- Admin-only access for privacy
- Useful for managing organization access
- Tenant admins can view whitelists for all orgs in their tenant

**Purpose**: Remove an email from organization whitelist

**Access**: Organization administrators
- **Super Admin**: Any organization
- **Tenant Admin**: Organizations in their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Their assigned organization

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `org_id` (UUID, required): Organization ID
- `email` (string, required): Email address to remove

**Notes**: 
- Removes email from join whitelist
- Email will no longer be able to join via token
- 404 if email not in whitelist
- Tenant admins can manage whitelists for all orgs in their tenant

item.name: ğŸ‘¥ USERS ENDPOINTS (UPDATED)
item.description: User management with proper tenant admin scoping - Multi-role access for CRUD operations

request.description:
**Purpose**: Create a new user (Admin operation)

**Access**: Multi-role with proper scoping
- **Super Admin**: Can create users anywhere
- **Tenant Admin**: Can create users within their tenant organizations
- **Org Admin**: Can create users within their organization

**Expected Response**: 201 Created

**UPDATED BEHAVIOR**: Proper tenant admin scoping implemented

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Body Parameters**:
- `email` (string, required): User's email address
- `password` (string, required): User's password
- `first_name` (string, required): User's first name
- `last_name` (string, required): User's last name
- `role` (string, optional): User role (default: 'user')
- `organization_id` (UUID, optional): Organization assignment
- `tenant_id` (UUID, optional): Tenant assignment

**Role Assignment Rules**:
- **Super Admin**: Can assign any role, any tenant/organization
- **Tenant Admin**: Can assign roles within their tenant scope
- **Org Admin**: Can only assign 'user' or 'member' roles within their org

**Real-World Usage**:
- Tenant Admin creates department heads and assigns them as org admins
- Org Admin creates team members and assigns them as members
- Different from public registration (more control)

**Notes**: 
- Different from public registration
- Allows setting initial role and assignments
- Admin-controlled user creation with scope validation
- Tenant admins restricted to their tenant organizations

**Purpose**: Get list of users with role-based filtering

**Access**: Multi-role with automatic scoping
- **Super Admin**: All users across all tenants
- **Tenant Admin**: Users within their tenant (all organizations)
- **Org Admin**: Users within their organizations
- **Members/Users**: Limited visibility

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**UPDATED BEHAVIOR**: Proper tenant admin scoping implemented

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {token}

**Query Parameters**: 
- Results automatically filtered by user role and permissions
- No manual filtering needed

**Filtering Logic**:
- **Super Admin**: All users in system
- **Tenant Admin**: All users in organizations within their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Users in organizations they manage
- **Regular User**: Very limited visibility (maybe just their own profile)

**Real-World Usage**:
- Tenant Admin can see all employees across all departments in their company
- Org Admin can see only their department employees
- Useful for user management and reporting

**Notes**: 
- Results filtered by user permissions automatically
- Returns user summaries (no sensitive data)
- Includes role and organization info
- Tenant admin gets company-wide visibility

**Purpose**: Get detailed information about a specific user

**Access**: Permission-based access with tenant scoping
- **Super Admin**: Any user
- **Tenant Admin**: Users within their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Users they manage
- **Users**: Their own profile only

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `user_id` (UUID, required): User ID to retrieve

**Notes**: 
- Returns detailed user information
- 403 if insufficient permissions
- 404 if user not found
- Tenant admins can view any user in their tenant
- Self-access always allowed

**Purpose**: Update user information (Admin or self)

**Access**: Role-based with tenant scoping
- **Super Admin**: Any user
- **Tenant Admin**: Users within their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Users they manage
- **Users**: Their own profile only

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `user_id` (UUID, required): User ID to update

**Body Parameters**:
- `first_name` (string, optional): New first name
- `last_name` (string, optional): New last name
- `email` (string, optional): New email address

**Notes**: 
- Partial updates supported
- Email uniqueness validated
- Self-update or admin permissions required
- Tenant admins can update any user in their tenant
- Role changes require separate endpoint

**Purpose**: Delete a user account

**Access**: High-level administrators only
- **Super Admin**: Any user
- **Tenant Admin**: Users within their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Limited delete permissions

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `user_id` (UUID, required): User ID to delete

**Notes**: 
- âš ï¸ **DESTRUCTIVE OPERATION** - Deletes user account
- Admin permissions required
- Cannot delete own account
- Removes user from all organizations
- Tenant admins can delete users within their tenant scope

**Purpose**: Activate a user account

**Access**: Administrators with proper scoping
- **Super Admin**: Any user
- **Tenant Admin**: Users within their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Users they manage

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `user_id` (UUID, required): User ID to activate

**Notes**: 
- Enables user account for login
- Admin permissions required
- User can access system after activation
- Tenant admins can activate users within their tenant

**Purpose**: Deactivate a user account

**Access**: Administrators with proper scoping
- **Super Admin**: Any user
- **Tenant Admin**: Users within their tenant
- **Org Admin**: Users they manage

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `user_id` (UUID, required): User ID to deactivate

**Notes**: 
- Disables user account login
- Admin permissions required
- User cannot access system when deactivated
- Reversible with activate endpoint
- Tenant admins can deactivate users within their tenant

**Purpose**: Update a user's role with enhanced tenant admin support

**Access**: Role-based with hierarchy validation
- **Super Admin**: Can assign any role to anyone
- **Tenant Admin**: Can assign roles within their tenant scope
  - Can promote users to org_admin for organizations in their tenant
  - Cannot assign tenant_admin or super_admin roles
- **Org Admin**: Limited role assignment within their organization

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**ENHANCED BEHAVIOR**: Proper tenant admin role assignment

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {admin_token}

**Path Parameters**:
- `user_id` (UUID, required): User ID to update role

**Body Parameters**:
- `role` (string, required): New role (user, org_admin, tenant_admin, super_admin)
- `organization_id` (UUID, conditional): Required when assigning org_admin role

**Role Assignment Rules**:
- **Super Admin**: Can assign any role anywhere
- **Tenant Admin**: 
  - Can assign org_admin to users for organizations in their tenant
  - Can assign member/user roles
  - Cannot assign tenant_admin or super_admin
- **Org Admin**: Can assign member/user roles within their org

**Real-World Workflow**:
1. Tenant Admin promotes department head to org_admin
2. Org Admin invites and manages team members
3. Clear hierarchy: super_admin > tenant_admin > org_admin > user

**Notes**: 
- Can only assign roles equal or lower than your own
- Role hierarchy validation enforced
- Tenant admins crucial for scaling admin duties
- Organization assignment required for org_admin role

**Purpose**: Get current user's profile information

**Access**: Any authenticated user (self)

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {token}

**Response**: Current user's profile data including:
- Basic profile info (name, email, etc.)
- Role information (global_role, organization_role)
- Tenant and organization associations
- Permissions summary

**Role Information Returned**:
- `global_role`: super_admin, tenant_admin, or user
- `organization_role`: admin, member, or null
- `tenant_id`: Associated tenant (for tenant admins)
- `organization_id`: Associated organization

**Notes**: 
- Returns own profile information
- Includes role and organization details
- Safe endpoint for profile views
- Useful for UI role-based feature display

**Purpose**: Update current user's own profile

**Access**: Any authenticated user (self)

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {token}

**Body Parameters**:
- `first_name` (string, optional): New first name
- `last_name` (string, optional): New last name
- `email` (string, optional): New email address

**Notes**: 
- Users can update their own profile
- Partial updates supported
- Email uniqueness validated
- Cannot change role or organization assignments
- Role changes must be done by administrators

**Purpose**: Alternative endpoint to get current user information

**Access**: Any authenticated user (self)

**Expected Response**: 200 OK

**Headers**:
- `Authorization`: Bearer {token}

**Response**: Current user's information

**Notes**: 
- Identical to /profile endpoint
- Alternative naming convention
- Moved from auth module to users module
- Returns same data as /profile
- Some APIs prefer /me endpoint naming
